comment.text: Had a 7PM reservation.  Did not get seated until 7:45.  They seemed to have no system in place to be aware of who was waiting for what table.  They did not communicate what you should do while waiting, so everyone stayed cramped in the main entrance because you did not know if you could go to bar an wait.  The hostess were overwhelmed and annoyed when you would ask them how much longer it would be.  Valet also 10 minute wait to even park.  Food is very very good.  Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgeable.  They seem to have front-end issues with over-booking and it kills the whole experience.  Not a single "We are sorry you waited 45 minutes when you had a reservation"

An absolutely stunning restaurant from the decor, employees, food, and to the drinks. Definitely earned the recommendation by Michelin. We did not have a reservation, and luckily did not have to wait at all! We were swiftly seated by the host then shortly greeted by the server. 

The drinks were fragrant and was SO good! I ordered the Spice Trade (& shamefully forgot what my friend had) and was amazed by the fragrant cocktail. For an appetizer to share we split the Mesabecha Hummus which came with Taftoun bread and pretty much cleaned off the plate. We loved it so much we almost ordered another serving. For our entrees, we had the Salmon Kookoo and Koobideh & Egg which were both delightful - made to perfection with refreshing sides. We also had a serving of the Tumeric Barbari and that was a perfect ending to our time with Delbar. This is probably the best restaurant for Middle Eastern food I've had here in Atlanta besides homemade food. 

I enjoyed our time at this location and look forward to visiting the one in Alpharetta.

Wow what a night! My husband brought me here to celebrate my birthday- I highly recommend this popular resturant. All the hype is true.  Excellent service, excellent food, beautiful resturant in a neighborhood that screams social & fun. 

I ordered everything the server suggested and he was right! A+ from the appetizer to the surprise birthday dessert.  The lamb is superb, use their seasoning for added kick...and don't forget the ice cream at the end.

I really enjoyed my first visit. The outside and inside decor is nice and warm and each table comes with hand sanitizer and a pole to hang your jacket or purse. 

The food was absolutely delicious; I went during brunch.
I ordered the Koobideh (Chicken) & Egg, with Sabzi Polo Rice, and then for desert I had the Baklava (came with two slices and a homemade fusion ice cream). 

The service was cool. We were seated immediately without a reservation and despite the crowd. The menu and method of payment is digital, so you're able to split the bill in many ways and pay with options. 

I plan to be back, but for the dinner menu.

photos.caption: Koobideh (Chicken) & Egg, with Sabzi Polo Rice

comment.text:
I definitely think the quality of this place has only gone up. The Michelin recommended status is well deserved.

Service is great and the ambiance is always a vibe. Even sitting outside in the winter is great because of the heaters and blankets. 

The dill labneh is a must have for sure. There's no reason to not get this. We split a lot of our foods. We got the chinjeh which is the best cut of meat they have in my opinion. They had a lamb tahcheen that night and that was really tasty! I had been craving it. And the kale and pear salad was refreshing. I also loved the baklava ice cream for dessert. The tea service they had was a great pomegranate and chia seed tea and I'd also recommend that!

photos.caption: Tahcheen, chinjeh and kale and pear salad

comment.text:
A few weeks ago, a friend and I were walk-ins for Brunch at Delbar. She had been raving about this place and the dinner menu. Delbar is a Middle Eastern restaurant serving a variety of cuisines including Iranian, Lebanese, and Turkish. So it was really easy to Eat Tha World in here! It's easy to see why they're on the Michelin guide.

The decor is stunning! Beautiful Middle Eastern elements and music throughout. They offer some tucked away seating a covered indoor-outdoor area, a bar, a regular outdoor area with fans and heat lamps as needed. We sat in the covered outdoor space, which was beautiful on a cold winter and overcast day. I forgot I was in Inman Park for a bit!

We had amazing service and food.  The mushroom peynirli pide was one of the best things I've eaten in my life, the Baklava ice cream sandwich is the most sinful sweet treat. We did experience a minor issue with one item but the manager and the chef rectified it quickly -- 5 star service on their parts. 

We ate the following things communal style:
-Chinjeh & eggs 
-KooKoo sabzi 
-Shroom peynirli pide and
-Baklava Ice Cream Sandwiches  

The next time I'm home, I'll be back for dinner

Came here with friends for dinner sometime around Thanksgiving. One of them had been here before and had been raving about it. And I would have to agree, I had a great time! The atmosphere is very laid back and the decor. The food is amazing - would recommend family style-ing it and sharing 
I think the only thing is next time I will not order as much as I have a small appetite (and so did another person at our table) and although it was recommended we order more dishes for our party (which we did), we had ample food for all four of us and probably could have done fine without the additional 1-2 dishes. My favorite dip will probably have to be the apricot/fig labneh! It's so smooth and just mildly sweet and super delicious!

This is actually my third time eating at this establishment and I am finally writing review. First time was last year 2023 for Father's Day. My family brought me here and I fell in love with this place.

Every time I've come, I sat at the bar and had a great time mingling with the bartenders and learning some of their specialty drinks. This time is in the afternoon so I had a light beer to go with the rest of my delicious food to start they have their cultural starter , which would be the equivalent of a basket of bread and other places. The cheese, radish, nuts, greens, and bread are all meant to open up the pallet and prepare you for decadence.

There's nothing that we ate that we did not enjoy the tiger shrimp was absolutely delicious. The only thing I would change, I rather have all that great sauce on the actual shrimp and not the shell, because I found myself rubbing the shrimp on the outside of the shell to get some of that great char flavor of it. we ordered a hummus type spread that had eggplants and some onions in there and oh my God I could have swirled my finger in that bowl just to eat it all up. It was so delicious. We pair the spread with the cultural bread and by that time we were already getting full.

Next, was the real reason we love this place, the rice! My Family and I are Caribbean people and rice and beans are a staple of our diet. Oh my young baby Jesus, there is no rice I have tasted/ eaten on planet Earth, quite like this. You can literally eat the entire mound of rice by yourself. If I was a dog, I would be growling at my wife for making me share the rice how absolutely delicious it was (she would be growling right back). The chicken kabobs are like ever other kabobs... but everything else is definitely a stand out. It's good for date nights it's good for groups, the ambience is beautiful. Apologies I didn't take any pictures, but the setting is absolutely beautiful and there is indoor and outdoor seating. The people in staff were also very nice people and inviting.

We will definitely be back to indulge ourselves again.

YES DELBAR YES. I'm always skeptical of super hyped places, even Michelin Guide ones, because I think restaurants can sometimes get a big ego and stop putting in the work. Delbar is not one of those places.

We tried to make reservations for a Friday night the day before which was not smart as it was basically full except for odd times. However, my friend was able to call on the day of and they were able to kindly squeeze us in with a strict 1.5 hour reservation. Amazing! 

The location is stunning. We sat in the covered patio which had a really nice ambiance. However, it was HOTTTT in there. It was super cold outside so I was dressed pretty warmly and I will say I was overheating and slightly uncomfortable. So maybe just wear layers? 

Service was TOP NOTCH - I don't know if all the servers are like this but ours was super personable, hilarious, and made us feel right at home. He offered many suggestions and checked on us many times to make sure we were having a good time. The drinks were great, I had two of the "We'll Always Have Paris." I was skeptical because of the mezcal, but it was perfect and not too overpowering.

For food, we ordered the hummus with mushrooms + egg yolk, the muhamarra, the lamb ribs, and the adas polo. Everything was amazing but the hummus absolutely blew me away. The egg yolk was one of the best additions to hummus I've had maybe ever. It was creamy and decadent and just EVERYTHING. 

We left extremely full with leftovers (FYI - the tahdig portions are huggeeee and can easily feed 4-5 people). I wish we had room for dessert because they also looked phenomenal. 

Splitting the bill was super easy as you can pay with your phone if you wish and either split the bill in half or pay for certain items.

photos.caption: Sadly the only picture I took -- the Spice Trade and We'll Always Have Paris

comment.text:
PARKING:
Parking is TOUGH here especially on Friday nights & weekends! Try to carpool or Uber. 

RESY: 
I highly recommend you make a resy, especially on Friday nights & weekends. It's usually packed so you can try to walk in, but you'd only be able to sit at the bar & there is usually a long wait for that. 

AMBIANCE:
They have indoor & outdoor seating. Obviously outdoor seating is less comfortable during the peak winter & summer months. They have heaters during winter, but it's still VERY COLD. It's cute & simple modern decor and has a very "HOME-Y" feel to it. It also smells amazing the moment you walk inside! 

FOOD:
$0 FREE BREAD & SNACKS: upon arrival they bring you complimentary naan-type bread accompanied with fresh mint, feta cheese, radishes, and some pecans to munch on before your apps arrive.

$14 ADANA BITE (appetizer): flatbread, lamb/beef kabob on top with onions & sauce. It was DELICIOUS! I almost could've just eaten this as my main. 

$7.50 (half order) DILL LABNEH DIP: I LOVE that they let you do a half order of any of their SPREADS! Especially if you are only ordering for one person it's much more manageable. This one was one of the most popular & delish! Like Tzatziki, refreshing but had a crunch in it - I assume some sort of nut? 

$29 LAMB KABOB: this had about 5 pieces of lamb, cooked medium. I ordered a side of the GARLIC TOUM (whipped garlic spread) and it was Devine! It's a lot of meat, I had leftovers. 

$5 GARLIC TOUM DIP: they recommend one of the dips for the protein kabobs. I'm a sauce person so I love them all! 

DRINKS:
$15 EY JOONAM: a vodka based drink, was light & refreshing. I'd definitely order this again! 

$15 SPICE TRADE: a gin based drink. This one definitely had more flavor than the EY JOONAM, but it just depends what you're in the mood for. Not super floral as most gin drinks are. I liked this drink the best. 

OVERALL:
It was a great first experience here! I got lucky as a walk in and immediate seats at the bar. Next time I'll make a resy and see what it's like at the tables. Will def be back to try the rest of the items on their menu. Chic & trendy spot with great food - go check it out!

photos.caption: $0 FREE BREAD & SNACKS: complimentary naan-type bread with fresh mint, feta cheese, radishes and pecans to munch on before your apps arrive
$14 ADANA BITE (appetizer): flatbread, lamb/beef kabob  with onions & sauce. I almost could've just eaten this as my main.

comment.text: I can see why this place is Michelin recognized! The staff were very friendly and inviting, food was truly worth the price, and wait wasn't bad at all! We got there on a Saturday night with no reservations but were told it was first come first serve at the bar so we waited around for no more than 15 minutes to be seated! Even while waiting, the staff were attentive, asking if we wanted to at least order apps or get drinks while we waited to be seated. I ordered the salmon kebab with the salmon appetizer. I could literally eat that appetizer for Ty meal for the rest of my life and be satisfied. Truly a wonderful experience, from start to finish!

Was referred here by my son who had visited while in Atlanta. He raved about "this really great restaurant in midtown for middle eastern food..." he was not wrong! This place was packed & we were lucky to find two seats together at the bar. Which I don't mind at all as the bar staff was amazing!
We opted to try a few things & share as we were told "you may want your share unless you want a lot to go!"
Chicken Shawarma was & is excellent food!
The beet appetizer/side dish was decadent. Hummus fresh & another large serving that would be great to share. 
Happened to sit next to a regular who shared what she was having & her suggestions of must tries. 
Exceptional food, drinks & experience! True must hit spot if in the midtown area. Swing off on a ride to or from ATL airport & be treated.

photos.caption: Hummus. Fresh & perfect - very large portions! Share a plate or side or app.
Each plate ordered gets this side plate that adds so much.
Big & wide bar - perfect to sit & eat. Gather with friends. Impeccable bar staff!
Beets. One of my favorite foods. This take was really really good!
This bread... fresh made in house & awesomeness

comment.text: I visited Delbar during their weekend brunch and had a wonderful experience. We were seated outside, which was perfect because it was such a lovely day out. The service was great. They were efficient and did an excellent job at answering any questions my group had. They accidentally served us the wrong entree, however quickly corrected their mistake and brought out the correct one instead. The food itself was delicious. I would go back for the hummus alone!

10s ACROSS THE BOARD!!! This restaurant is a a WHOLE vibe!! Middle Eastern vibe that is! When you walk in, you're immediately greeted by the hostesses and you can feel the amazing energy. Middle Eastern music is playing throughout and the atmosphere is very upbeat. The decor is spot on with lots of Persian-style area rugs on the floor, large plants, and low ambient lighting! It's kind of loud as there is lots of conversations and "Ooooh's and Ahhhh's" happening around us! But it didn't bother me. 

Now for the amazing food!! Absolutely DELICIOUS!! Everything understood the assignment!! We started with the Omani shrimp! They bring you 4 Tiger Prawns seasoned to perfection with this delicious yogurt based sauce that is to die for! Be prepared to have messy hands but they do bring you a warm towel with lemon to clean up! Lol!! We also had the hummus! It was sooo light, fluffy, and flavorful. The crunchy chickpeas on top were a great touch and added a little more depth to this appetizer! 

For the main course, we had the Joojeh Kabobs, Salmon Kabobs, and the Sabzi Polo! The meats were tender and the Middle Eastern spices were front and center. The Sabzi Polo is a Basmati rice topped with crunchy fried onions. It is definitely large enough to share amongst three or four people! 

Lastly, for dessert we shared the Baklava. It is paired with best ice cream I've had in a long time! It was rose water, saffron, vanilla ice cream that was super tasty and paired perfectly with the flaky, buttery, nutty, and sweet Baklava. It also goes great with the Turkish coffee!! Yummy!! 

Now, of course I can't forget the impeccable service we received! Our server, Michael V., recommended great food options, was super attentive, kept our table cleared, and exuded great energy!! This was our first time visiting this restaurant BUT will definitely not be our last!! I will definitely be back with my friends! 

Oh! One last thing, parking isn't all that great as it is mostly street parking. Other than that, this place is AMAZING!! Our bill wasn't bad either! About $112 for 2 people! I didn't order alcohol though!

photos.caption: Palate cleanser! That feta cheese is super silky and delicious!
Baklava & Rose Water infused ice cream

comment.text:
This place was pretty exceptional. The food, flavors, ambiance, service, decor... all great. Came here on a Monday night, getting reservations wasn't easy. We were able to snag a 9:30pm resy which is late for some so it's best to book in advance. 

We ordered the Omani shrimp to start. 10/10. Couldn't ask for more flavorful, perfectly cooked shrimp. The sauce that was on the side was a perfect addition. We ordered the hummus topped with lamb. 10/10. One of the best hummuses I've ever had. A must have when dining here. We ordered the Koobideh Kebab. 9/10. Could be juicier but otherwise great. We also ordered the za'taar fries as a side. 8/10. Good, not great. The spicy tahini it comes with was too spicy and the fries were huge. Next time would probably order one of the rice dishes as a side instead of fries.

The star of the evening was the desert. We ordered the pistachio lava cake. Everything about this was just perfect. The gooey center, the pistachio pieces, the cardamom gelato. 10/10. Would get again in a heartbeat. 

Strongly recommend this restaurant and will revisit next time i visit Atlanta.

I normally don't write for places with so many reviews, however I think a waiter needs a shout out for how impressed I was. Nasr is an amazing server, from his knowledge of the menu, to his kind nature, and upmost professionalism. I go out to eat a lot, and it's been a while since I've had a server that good.

We came here on a Thursday nite, and it was packed with no availability for a few hours. The GM was determined to get us a seat. He said he had a big party that was coming in 10 min, but if they all didn't show he would get us a table.  We waiting 10 min and he found us a table outside. It was in the mid 40's and we were so comfy! I enjoyed being outside more, bc it wasn't as noisy. Of course the food was incredible. Every bite I took of lamb my eyes rolled. We got the shrimp appetizer, lamb skewers, onion rice, and a condiment. I was more than enough for two people.
My only complaint is the wine is just as much as the cocktails. Overall the best service at a restaurant on a crowded night.  Can't wait to come back!

Had the most delightful evening at Delbar, sipping on Lebanese wine and indulging in a fantastic spread of traditional Middle Eastern cuisine. The chic and relaxing decor instantly transported me to the Iranian countryside that owner Fares Kargar grew up in.

Delbar, meaning "heart, captured" in Farsi, is a love letter to the influential dishes that shaped Fares' youth. The menu is a delicious journey through the flavors of his childhood, with mouthwatering Persian dishes that truly hit the spot! If you're looking for an unforgettable culinary adventure, look no further than Delbar!

Service was smooth. Especially at around 10:30pm. I love the middle eastern vibes I was getting from the ambiance. It was warm and comfortable. 8.5/10 The drink was delicious, but the lamb could have used a little more salt and maybe some other flavors instead of a minty flavor. It was tender, but wasn't my favorite. And I LOVE lamb. 6/10 for Food. I will be returning to try something different but I recommend for date night.
A wonderful Valentine's Day dinner spent at delbar. The food and service were both amazing. We decided to share the steak and it was delicious.

I brought my parents to Delbar for my dad's 65th birthday dinner (after extensively asking around to my coworkers about where they recommended going) and we LOVED it. We didn't have a reservation so we just went early for dinner and were able to get a table. Honestly the host was so nice, and made us feel really welcome. Our waitress was also incredibly nice and friendly, she made really good recommendations on what to order, explained the menu items and answered all our questions.

At the risk of sounding like a total millennial, the vibes were on point too. The music was a tad loud but it really brought out a fun environment and you could tell people were enjoying themselves. On that note, I thought the cocktails were tasty too!

The food was really very well made and the menu was diverse with a lot of really great flavors - our waitress did tell us it's different types of middle eastern dishes but I wish the website would have a more fleshed out "our story" section or something. Either way, I really love to see this type of food get so much recognition and love from the people of Atlanta (seriously almost all of my coworkers independently recommended it).

Our favorite dish actually was the Muhamara spread, it just had such an amazing flavor profile. The lamb shank was also cooked so perfectly, the meat was actually falling off the bone - they give you a knife but you don't even need it. The sea bass paired really nicely with the pickled veggies too. And the rice dish was a huge serving (actually all the servings for all the dishes were really generous). Then at the end, they brought out some baklava with saffron ice cream that was so amazing I could probably eat it every day of my life.. my mom damn near licked the ice cream bowl (I'm exaggerating but she did really like it).

Seriously, go to Delbar as soon as you get the chance!

photos.caption: Baklava with cardamom or saffron ice cream(?)

comment.text: I went to this restaurant for my birthday dinner and had a great experience. Staff was extremely accommodating of my party and continuously checked in on us. The food came out quickly and was absolutely delicious. The food was mostly family style which was great for my party of 8. I would recommend getting a few things to share. The bill splitting process was different than I've ever seen before. You can access the tab via mobile device and each person is able to select what they got and what they would like to pay for and all payments could be down through the phone. The process was mostly seamless and worked well for my party's size. Overall, I this restaurant was great and I will be returning!

If you are wandering the Beltline or Inman Park/Old Fourth Ward area seeking out a great meal, do yourself a favor and go to Delbar!!! 

The cuisine is authentic, flavorful, generous portion sizes and did I say flavorful???!!!! 

When I dined I enjoyed my meal at bar for a nice solo date night. Bartender (Matt) was attentive and on point with pairing recommendations across small plates, greens & grains, mezze, and wines. The dried lime, citrus, pear, and savory flavors all played off each other. 

I enjoyed the following: 
- Shroom & Shishito Hummus (w/o egg, b/c I don't them)
- Kale Pear Salad 
- Omani Shrimp ( which I ended up slicing and adding to my salad) 
- Sharbat e Zereshk (zero proof drink) 
- Buketo White Wine from Macedonia, Greece
- Ginger Date Cake - Dessert was  the only thing I hated was the tahini mousse.

It's so busy here tonight for a Sunday night. It's good we only have a small party of two, our small count got us a table quicker. 

We started off with a Falafel plate, labneh with squash and figs, hummus, chicken kafta, green zhoug, torshi, spicy tahina, garlic toum. $94.74.

The labneh is different as a sweet spread. The labneh tastes as if there is cream cheese in it, even though there isn't any in it. It's quite good for labneh. 

The torshi isn't too bad, could be a bit more pickled flavor for me. It's more of a dry pickled veggie. 

The chicken kafta is dry, so is the falafel.

The appetizers and starters are good here, the entrees aren't as good as the start of our meal though.

The green ghouj and the spicy tahina are both good. The garlic toum isn't garlicky enough, doesn't have much flavor to it actually.

I came here for brunch with some friends. All of the dishes and drinks were fantastic. I'd recommend getting a few and sharing them, unless there is one in particular that you want just for yourself. 

The decor is super trendy and fun and the staff is very welcoming and nice.
I love this place and have since Day 1.  Recently I made it to dessert for the first time. The ice cream/baklava was a delight.

I enjoyed everything about this place. The decor is awesome & the hand sanitizer on the table is a nice touch. Everything we ordered was solid. We ordered the Kashk bademjoon (eggplant), falafel plate, sabzi polo & adas polo, Lamb kebab, chinjeh (beef sirloin) and Turkish coffee and 2 drinks.
Great food and service! Interior takes you to a new world. The portions are quite large and filling. The shrimp was delicious and so was the dill dip!

The vibes are great, I was getting tulum vibes, very cool tableware also! Our reservation was at 9 and we weren't seated until 9:35. Our waiter was not the friendliest either. Only giving 4 stars because of the service. He also recommended way too much food. We told him we could not take home leftovers as we were going out, and we had about 4 plates leftover. 

The food was great. I started with a dirty martini and these were the best olives I have ever had.  To start we had the dill labneh and Shroom hummus. Both sooo full of flavor and delicious. The fries were interesting, they were thick but the sauce was sooo good. For the main I had the koobideh kabob and the chinjeh beef. The beef and the lamb was on if the best entrees I have had. We got it with rice and it was just the perfect bite. Would dine here again!

Beautiful restaurant! Vibrant with indoor and outdoor seating complete with heaters and blankets. Very busy! Service was outstanding with explanation of the menu. Food was excellent with the exception of the heirloom tomato salad, they were definitely not heirloom tomatoes and rather bland and subpar. The salmon kabob was my favorite

The food was excellent! Our server was very knowledgeable and helpful when placing our orders. We had no idea what to get because everything sounded so delicious so we essentially asked our server "what's your favorite?" "What can/would you recommend for a vegetarian?" And he did not disappoint. The restaurant was beautiful and the staff, from the host to the server was awesome. 10/10 would recommend this place easily!

Delicious food and classy atmosphere! The prices were also pretty reasonable for what it is. The hummus and meats were my favorites. Service was also good. The only complaint I have is that it was very loud inside when it gets busy. We were a table of six and couldn't really have a conversation together because we couldn't hear each other well. Parking was a bit hard to find, had to street park a 5 min walk away.

My experience tonight was A1. I enjoyed my entire experience from our waiter customer service and attentiveness to everything placed in front of us. The drinks were good and strong. I had the Saudi money and the Long live the Shah. Delicious, especially it you like the signature old fashion drink. We had the hummus with lamb for the appetizer. I ordered the Branzino, and my partner had one of the  lamb kabobs. We both throughly enjoyed our selection and our visit.

Eating here for lunch was a taste bud tantalizing experience. We got lucky too! No reservation and we got seated. I heard the host say that I was last available table and now there was a wait. IT WAS MEANT TO BE. 

Starting with the Mesabecha Hummus... let me say... we should've ordered two!! D. E. L. I. C. I. O. U. S. For the drink I had a Golestan Palace. The flavor profile was so complex but I was able to taste every element, A+. For my entre I got the Tumeric Barbari with a single fried egg. Just Devine all around. 

The place was packed at every angle for the brunch service. It was beautiful outside so I can imagine it would've been great to sit outside too! MAKE A RESERVATION you don't want to have to wait for such a great spot!

photos.caption: Tumeric Barbari (bottom), single fried egg, Kobideh & Egg (top)

comment.text:
's across the board!!!! 
Hummus w/ mushrooms: 10/10 
Dill Labneh w/lamb: 10/10
Sabzi Polo: 10/10
Koobideh Kabob: 10/10

Delbar is going on my top restaurants list hands down!! This restaurant does Middle Eastern family style cuisine amazinglyyyy. We went to the Inman Park location which was beautiful, but if you're wanting the flowers everywhere and vibrant decor make sure you go to the Alpharetta location! 

Family style food can be hit or miss, and this spot did not miss!! Your meal begins with complimentary bread and palette cleansers. The table ordered some of their spreads to try: Dill Labneh w/ Lamb, Labneh w/ Lamb, &  Hummus w/ mushrooms & egg. All of them were delicious, my favorite being the hummus!! As a grain we shared the Sabzi Polo, & my individual meat selection was the Koobideh Kabob (lamb & beef). 

Overall, the food was stellar and worth the price! Expect to spend a good bit of money here, but just know it's worth it! Such a great conversation ambiance with service to match! Highly, highly, highly recommend

So I was skeptical because I wasn't sure I was a fan of Middle Eastern cuisine. I had been meaning to try the Alpharetta location -- you know the one with the pretty flowers everywhere but this location was nice as well. Inman Park is a great neighborhood in Atlanta.

This restaurant serves food family style, which I was hesitant about especially with a large group because everyone's taste and budget varies but with the right people I highly, highly, highly suggest this place. Complimentary bread with seasonal pairings is available. We started off with three spreads for a group of nine -- dill labneh w/ lamb, labneh with lamb, and the hummus. My personal favorite was the regular labneh with lamb!

For our entree I ordered the lamb neck with the sabzi polo and omgggggg. So so so so good. I was skeptical about the cinnamon in the ingredients list but if you're a fan of like coconut curry this taste almost similar. The rice was well seasoned and the broth that the lamb neck was 10/10. I had to take some to go because it was very filling. The rice doesn't look that big in pictures but I think it can comfortably feed no more than 3 people.

Service was amazing! Our waiter made sure our cups were filled with water and brought up more bread as need be.

Now that I'm more certain about middle eastern food, I have to go back to the Alpharetta location and try more of the menu.

The $$$ is true -- my meal with the service charge was $61. Our table of 9 had a total bill of $483 ($50 added for the birthday cake we brought on our own, something to note if you're planning on doing to the same) so on average I'd say expect to spend at least $60 here. Food was worth it in my opinion!

Check out my food page @helenaonyelp for a more inside scoop!

photos.caption: Labneh with lamb (front) Dill labneh with lamb (back)

comment.text:
The rest of the food and drinks didn't even make it to the pictures. They were devoured before a phone could even be pulled out!

This is my absolute favorite place to eat in Atlanta, i could eat this every day. I've tried pretty much everything on the menu and somehow each time i come it gets getter every time! 

The service is always A1 and the drinks are one of best in the city. Rather you're looking for a date night, lunch with friends, or a solo late lunch this is the place!

Delbar is a great restaurant to go to if you are looking for great Middle Eastern food. The restaurant staff is super friendly and accommodating. The food came out fairly quickly and it was super delicious. A big plus was that the pita seemed to be unlimited. I would definitely come out here again.

Service was friendly, professional, with just the right touch. We ate outside,  lucky to catch the beautiful February weather in the 60s. The food was served promptly and beautifully. 20-min walk on the Beltway from the Ponce City Market area.

photos.caption: Complimentary bread comes with fresh herbs, cheese, walnuts
Chicken koftka, wood fired salmon, roasted vegetables, added  garlic toum condiment

comment.text: Amazing drinks and service and beautiful ambiance. Even the tableware was a topic of conversation. We went bar-hopping after dinner but we should have just stayed at Delbar. The waiter helped us choose what/how to order. You're going to walk away with a huge bill though for how many things you'll be encouraged to sample  Less is more to start.

Let's start with the drawbacks: 1. This place is so crowded. Like, packed to the brim on a Thursday night. Like, you can barely hear yourself think because the acoustics are terrible. Like, you still have to wait 20 minutes for a table despite having a reservation (for 3 people, at that!). WHY? 

Oh, ok, because the food is phenomenal. It's starting to make sense. I would really only deal with this kind of annoying crowd situation (and the whole scanning the menu on a QR code and paying with the QR code) for amazing food. And it's worth it.

We had the hummus with lamb (yes, 100% yes, would order every time) that comes with the excellent taftoun bread (my best comparison would be pita bread, but it's not that - just trust that it's good). We also split the heirloom tomato salad. Every restaurant in Atlanta has an heirloom tomato salad right now. This one was so good and fresh and had great crunch cucumbers too.

Then we split these three things as an entree: Adas polo, Chicken Kofta, and Koobideh Kabob. The Adas polo is rice with lentils and raisins, and it is SO large and impressive looking, and pairs very well with kebobs. The koobideh (ground lamb, beef and onion) was our favorite, and I enjoyed the chicken kofta too, but note that it's a little spicy.

Oh and how could I forget that my "heat of the moment" cocktail was the best spicy margarita I've had in YEARS.

The three of us were so full, and we had enough leftovers for maybe 3 meals. So for three, we probably could have done just one appetizer or just one kebab. No regrets because the leftovers were so good. I can't wait to come back (maybe on a Monday or something it won't be so hectic? I don't know).

photos.caption: chicken kofta, koobideh kabob, adas polo - all amazing

comment.text:
I love Middle Eastern food and Delbar does it right! It tends to get pretty busy here so I definitely recommend making a reservation. My waiter made some great recommendations: Adana Bite, Sabzi polo and Joojeh kabob which were great! My waiter also made sure to check on me frequently as I dined alone. They give a huge portion of rice so you'll definitely have leftovers. I wish they gave more meat but all in all you will not be disappointed. 

I will definitely make my way back in the future. 

Tip: park in parking deck down the street and make a reservation in advance

I've never had Persian/Iranian food before coming to Delbar, and I think the restaurant set my standards high for that genre. The service was great and attentive, but our server's voice was quiet, so we couldn't hear half of what he was explaining because the restaurant was very noisy with multiple different conversations going and our close proximity to the kitchen. The place was packed at 9pm, which was pretty late. I was surprised, but I presume that it's because of how popular it is. We made a reservation for 3, and we were seated at a table meant for 6 people. A pleasant surprise.

Food was incredible, even if it was a little pricey. Tons of flavor packed into every dish.

I like how our order is synced through the QR code that is on our table, and we can pay using our phones. It has been a couple of weeks since I visited, but I can still view the details of our bill, which is crazy. I don't know how that works.

5/5 will visit again, maybe at their new location that's opening soon.

photos.caption: Pre meal appetizer. Didn't order this, it just came!

comment.text:
My experience at Delbar was amazing from start to finish, and I was so grateful that my friends had introduced me to the place.  From the moment I arrived, I was in awe of the trendy vibe, buzzling atmosphere, and creative menu.  We were lucky to get a table in the pretty courtyard, which was accompanied by very friendly and efficient service.  

Though their cocktail menu was very interesting, I was more intrigued by their zero-proof drink list.  I asked if I could get their Sharbat e Khiyar mix of cucumber, coconut, mint, and citrus with vodka, which they were happy to do.  The drink had a lot of cucumber and coconut flavors, in particular.  It was more like a boozy smoothie and was very refreshing.

In terms of food, we decided to order a bunch of items and share them.  We started with 2 spreads - the Kashk Bademjoon and the Muhamara.  The first was a creamy blend of fried eggplant, onion, mint, and whey, which was topped with crispy, fried onion strings.  The Muhamara, on the other hand, was a sweet blend of roasted red pepper, walnut, and pomegranate molasses.  I thought they were both excellent, and the portions were more than generous, though I was partial to the pepper spread.  The dips were accompanied by taftoun bread, which was like a crunchy pita, sprinkled with black sesame seeds.  

Next, we ordered a few things from the Greens & Grains section of their menu.  The Beet Carpaccio started with thinly sliced red beets that were elegantly adorned with whipped feta, burnt honey, sour orange, and a pistachio and almond dukkha.  The beets and cheese were particularly fresh and bright; this really was a perfect dish for the warm weather.  The Adas Polo, on the other hand, was a heartier mound of crispy, saffron basmati rice, that was infused with lentils and raisins.  It was satisfyingly sweet and filling.  

Lastly, we shared 2 main courses.  The wild-caught, Chilean Seabass came in 3 small fillets that had been seasoned with onion and saffron.  The Lamb Loin had been marinated with yogurt and grilled.  It was infused with notes of citrus, saffron, and garlic.  Both proteins were so fall-apart tender that they melted in our mouths.  They were also examples of simple food done well, in that they had been lightly grilled, but blowed us away with their impact.  

My experience at Delbar was one of the best meals I had had in a long time.  I was in love and will definitely have the restaurant on my to-do list for my next visit to the area.

photos.caption: Wild-caught, Chilean seabass fillets, onion, saffron
Adas Polo - tahdig, lentil, raisin, saffron basmati
Lamb Loin - yogurt, citrus, saffron, garlic
Kashk Bademjoon - fried eggplant, onion, mint, cream of whey  Muhamara - roasted pepper and walnut, pomegranate molasses + taftoun bread
Beet Carpaccio - red beets, whipped feta, burnt honey, sour orange, pistachio and almond dukkha

comment.text:
This place was fantastic. The trend as of late is aesthetics over flavor, but here that isn't the case.

The wings came highly rated by the server as one of the best in Atlanta. He's right and you should experience them for yourself. 

Same thing goes for the lamb hummus. I'll be back again to explore more!

We ordered way too food for three people. I'd recommend two entrees and two small plates (one with rice). We got the adana bite, muhamra, dill labneh, field pea salad, rice with crispy onion, chicken koftka and stuffed branzino.

I didn't have any of the meat dishes but can say that everything else was very good. My favorite was probably the stuffed branzino, rice and muhamra. The stuffed branzino was so flakey and soft. The rice was perfectly spiced and crispy onions added a lovely texture. The muhamra is a walnut spread that had a slight sweetness. 

They have a complimentary flat bread that you can eat with the spreads you order. If you can cream cheese you'd probably love the labneh. It's shiploads to be yoghurt but honestly is very creamy and slightly tangy like cream cheese. 

The servers were very attentive and the restaurant was packed. I recommend getting a reservation because I had one for 6:30pm but they weren't able to clear a table for us until 7pm for 3 people.

I can't rave about this place enough!! I had been wanting to go to Delbar for so long, so I finally made a reservation for my birthday dinner. My birthday was on a Monday, but even then, it was super crowded so definitely get a reservation! Parkingwise, you can find street parking in Inman Park, park in a paid deck, or go for the complimentary parking in the Mariposa Lofts parking after 6pm. 

To drink, I had the Istanbul Nights which had a really good mezcal. Our waiter also had really good recs and was so friendly and fun! We began with flatbread as well as hummus and dill labneh. We also had a plate of nuts, radishes, and other refreshing herbs to cleanse our palate between courses. The spreads were SO GOOD. The hummus was creamy and the labneh was absolutely tangy and divine. We also tried the Zaa'tar fries which were so yummy!!

For the main course, we ordered some dishes family-style (and I definitely recommend this so you can try a lot)! For our table of 8, we got two rices (they are large portions), the sabzi polo and adas polo. For meats, we got the chicken kofta, 2 lamb necks, koobideh kabob (lamb and beef), and joojeh kabob (chicken). The rice was great, I loved the sabzi which was the savory rice, but the adas was sweeter and also delicious. The meats were all super tender but the lamb neck was my personal favorite. The meat was literally falling off the bone and the stew it came in was delicious!! There was plenty to go around and we definitely still had leftovers. 

At the end, our waiter was so sweet and brought out a portion of baklava and rose-flavored ice cream. The baklava was so delicious and just a great way to cap the night. Overall, I had an absolutely amazing dinner and can't wait to return to Delbar to try the brunch!!

Family brought me here while I was visiting and the place was hopping with upbeat vibes. 

The cocktails were great, service was attentive and the food was very good. Everything was prepared well and I would've given it 5 stars if the food had more the traditional masala flavors, which is a personal preference.

Amazing date night experienced at Delbar Inman Park location! This restaurant came highly recommended by several friend groups so we decided to try it out and it truly did not disappoint. Everything, and I do mean everything, was extremely flavorful. From the starters, to the grains, the spreads, the entrees and cocktails- there is something on the menu for everyone!! My husband is a picky eater and even he found everything to be tasty!

Make a reservation !! Parking is a bit tough especially on the weekend! We arrived an hour earlier than our reservation time (oops!) and the staff graciously got us seated right away! Our server, Q, was amazing ! He walked us through the entire menu and made great recommendations. 

The shrimp, wings, dill labneh, the bread, sheesh everything !! The sea bass deserves a review on her own, but due to time I'll just say- order it!!!!!

We will be back soon to experience their brunch menu!

Did celebrate my birthday last week at Delbar (Inman park location) 
The ambiance , vibe, service was pretty great. 
No complains there. 

Everything we ordered tasted pretty fresh and great. 
Special mention to  the feta cheese they serve so light, fresh and tasty. If you love cheese you would love it. I Ordered it twice lol. 
Also did order the rice it had fried onion in it, did not get the picture of it but it tasted pretty good. 
Only thing I did not like was the wings, a lot of them raved about it, but surprisingly it was really charred, and tasted really sweet. No one at our table liked those may be it's our taste buds . We sent it back and did not get charged for it. 
Overall a good experience but I do like the Alpharetta location better but when you compare the timing for weekdays this location works!

photos.caption: Chicken kofta and joojeh kabab ( all chicken)

comment.text: I Loved t Hu is place! The vibe is super kool and the food is amazing! There were so many interesting things I ordered to try as many things as possible! If you like lamb you'll Love the lamb ribs. I've had this dish before at several Mediterranean or Middle Eastern restaurants and this one is the best.  The kale and pear salad is great! Hummus amazing! Crispy rice with lentils and raisins was a delicious surprise! I also Loved the Shrimp appetizer. We were served by several servers who were super attentive!
